meta.name: description
meta.content: Perryton Independent School District is a 4A district offering a quality education for students in Pre-K - 12th Grade that involves all students, teachers, community and parents in a highly motivated and positive learning process in a way that: Involves all cultures, increases opportunities for parental involvement through communication of students' improvement, rewards strong character, positive attitude, and celebrates academic improvements.

div.h4: Board Officially Hires Mireles As Superintendent, Haberthur As AD/Head Coach Posted Date: 04/02/2020
div.p: The Perryton ISD Board of Directors met in a special meeting on Wednesday morning, April 1, to officially hire James Mireles as Superintendent of Perryton ISD . . .

div.h4: NHS Inducts 57 New Members Posted Date: 03/10/2020
div.p: The PHS Chapter of National Honor Society inducted 57 new members on Thursday, March 5 . . .
Rangerettes Gisselle Hernandez and Cassidy Farney were selected to the All-District Girls’ Basketball Team for District 4-4A. . . .
Students cozy up to a good book in preparation for their literature project in Mrs. Zavala’s English II class. . . .

p.span:
Students needing Wi-Fi access can go to:
Perryton High School parking lot
Perryton Junior High Parking lot
Key Heights Baptist Parking Lot
Four Square Gospel Parking Lot
There are guest accounts available at each location. Look for PISD Guest or Ranger Guest The password is Rangers#1.
Community Worship Center has a guest wi-fi in their parking lot that they have offered to our students.
Other options are in the works.
Filing remains closed despite date change.

Candidates:
Mike Heck (Incumbent)
Lane Haley
Ramon Vela
Shane Slover
Perla Gonzalez
Pete DeSantiago

div.p: Perryton Independent School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age or disability in admission, access to, or treatment or employment, in its programs or activities including internet content. Procedures for resolving accessibility issues can be found here

For more information about this policy or Title IX and Age Act of 1975 & Title II, Section 504 contact:Robin Fulce Superintendent; 821 SW 17th Ave. Perryton, Texas 79070 (806) 435-5478 Email: rfulce@perrytonisd.com
To file a formal grievance regarding Section 504 and Title II, CLICK HERE

span.strong: Click for a live view from atop the Perryton ISD Administration Building

div.p: Our resolve is to integrate students, teachers, parents and community in a highly motivated, positive learning process. It is our intent to involve all cultures, to increase opportunities for parental involvement through constant communication of student progress, reward strong character and positive attitude, and celebrate academic achievement. Consequently, students will be motivated to make informed, responsible choices and become life-long learners and productive members of society.
